required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Cause Trial: A Randomized Trial of Aerobic Exercise on CVD Risk Factors in Breast Cancer Survivors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the effects of aerobic exercise to usual care in women treated with chemotherapy and radiation therapy for non-metastatic breast cancer

primary_outcome.description: Peak oxygen uptake during a treadmill based cardiopulmonary exercise test

secondary_outcome.measure: Systolic- and diastolic heart chamber dimensions
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiac morphology and function will be assessed by 2D and 3D Echocardiography and 2D strain echocardiography
Cardiac morphology and function will be assessed by 2D and 3D Echocardiography and 2D strain echocardiography
Body composition will be assessed by dual x-ray absorptiometry
Body composition will be assessed by dual x-ray absorptiometry
Hemoglobin mass and blood volume will be assessed using the carbon monoxide rebreathing method
Change in muscle morphology will be assessed in muscle biopsies using immunohistochemistry
Change in muscle morphology will be assessed in muscle biopsies using immunohistochemistry
Change in mitochondrial proteins will be assessed in muscle biopsies using western blot

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life: Quality of Life Questionnaire (QLQ) C-30
secondary_outcome.description: Relevant patient reported outcomes will be obtained using validated Quality of Life Questionnaire (QLQ) C-30

arm_group.description: The aim is for participants to complete three weekly sessions of supervised aerobic treadmill based exercise for five months. Session duration varies from 20-60 minutes, with exercise intensity ranging from 55-95% of peak heart rate. Maximal exercise capacity (VO2peak and peak heart rate), will be determined by the CPET performed by certified exercise physiologists at baseline.
Participants in this arm will not receive any follow-up on exercise during the intervention period.

Participants in this arm are age-matched women with no history of any malignant disease, which will undergo similar assessments at baseline and post-intervention and also follow similar exercise intervention as the breast cancer survivors randomized to the Aerobic exercise arm

intervention.description: Participants will be randomized to supervised aerobic exercise or standard care. Women with no current or past malignant disease will comprise the reference group and will be matched for age to participants in the Aerobic Exercise arm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Eligible BCS must be listed in the Norwegian Cancer registry
- Female
- Adult-onset breast cancer diagnosis, diagnosed between 2008 and 2012
- 60 years or younger at the time of diagnosis
- received anthracycline-based chemotherapy as a part of their treatment history
- signed informed consent and medical doctors approveal of participation prior to inclusion
Exclusion Criteria:
- Received Herceptin
- Diagnosed with stage IV breast cancer
- Relapse since diagnosis
- A history, or current presence, of another diagnosis of invasive cancer of any kind
- Selfreported severe fatigue
- present with any uncontrolled- or recent cardiovascular disease, has undergone heart surgery or uses a pacemaker
- currently exercising more than 90 minutes per week
